1.text: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,

2.text: Therefore do my thoughts cause me to answer, and for this I make haste.

3.text: I have heard the check of my reproach, and the spirit of my understanding causeth me to answer.

4.text: Knowest thou not this of old, since man was placed upon earth,

5.text: That the triumphing of the wicked is short, and the joy of the hypocrite but for a moment?

6.text: Though his excellence shall mount up to the heavens, and his head reach to the clouds;

7.text: Yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung: they who have seen him shall say, Where is he?

8.text: He shall fly away as a dream, and will not be found: yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.

9.text: The eye also which saw him shall see him no more; neither shall his place any more behold him.

10.text: His children shall seek to please the poor, and his hands shall restore their goods.

11.text: His bones are full of the sin of his youth, which shall lie down with him in the dust.

12.text: Though wickedness may be sweet in his mouth, though he may hide it under his tongue;

13.text: Though he may spare it, and forsake it not; but keep it still within his mouth:

14.text: Yet his food in his bowels is turned, it is the gall of asps within him.

15.text: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.

16.text: He shall suck the poison of asps: the viperâ€™s tongue shall slay him.

17.text: He shall not see the river, the floods, the brooks of honey and buttermilk.

18.text: That which he labored for shall he restore, and shall not swallow it: according to his substance shall the restitution be, and he shall not rejoice in it.

19.text: Because he hath oppressed and hath forsaken the poor; because he hath violently taken away a house which he did not build.

20.text: Surely he shall not feel quietness in his belly, he shall not save of that which he desired.

21.text: There shall none of his food be left; therefore shall no man look for his goods.

22.text: In the fullness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits: every hand of the wicked shall come upon him.

23.text: When he is about to fill his belly, God shall cast the fury of his wrath upon him, and shall rain it upon him while he is eating.

24.text: He shall flee from the iron weapon, and the bow of steel shall strike him through.

25.text: It is drawn, and cometh out of the body; yes, the glittering sword cometh out of his gall: terrors are upon him.

26.text: All darkness shall be hid in his secret places: a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.

27.text: The heaven shall reveal his iniquity; and the earth shall rise up against him.

28.text: The increase of his house shall depart, and his goods shall flow away in the day of his wrath.

29.text: This is the portion of a wicked man from God, and the heritage appointed to him by God.
